turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: And she used her tits and that cute little ass to get him, didn't she?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: You've got to go now, Dil --

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Where am I to go, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Got you the multivitamins and the iron tablets, hon --

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Sorry, love. Now, the white ones are magnesium supplement --

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: I've got to keep you healthy, Jimmy. I'm counting the days. Two thousand three hundred and thirty-four left.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: I'm sorry, darling. I keep forgetting the leap year. What am I supposed to call you then, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Fergus. Fergus my love, light of my life - -

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Can't help it. You're doing time for me. No greater love, as the man says. Wish you'd tell me why.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: As the man said, it's in my nature.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Jimmy, is it? Do you know me, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Yeah. Just checking. He being nice to you, Dil?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Ever so nice. Aren't you, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: That's good. I'm glad. Young love, as they say.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Absolutely. The younger the better. Doesn't come your way much, I suppose.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Don't go looking for it, Dil.

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: Well, maybe you'll get lucky. Someday.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: A bit heavy on the powder, isn't she, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: DIL
turns.text: A girl has to have a bit of glamour.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Absolutely. Long as she can keep it. Isn't that right, James...

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: You're back in the pink, Tommy? How're you keeping?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: You'll notice I've asked you nothing.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: All right, then. I like to be wise.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: So what do you need, Fergus?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Need to go across the water.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: There are certain things I wouldn't do for my country.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Poke him or something. See if he's still alive.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Hasn't moved for twelve hours. Go on. Have a heart.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Fucking do. I had him all over me.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Put that thing back on him, Fergus.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Doesn't matter if he's hot. Just cover the fucker up.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: What was it, Fergus? Did you blow the gaff on us or did you just fuck up?

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: No. That's the last thing I'll do. You never asked what happened.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Maguire and me got out by the skin of our teeth. No thanks to you.... What you think of the hair?

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: We had a court-martial in your absence. They wanted to put a bullet in your head. I pleaded for clemency. Said we should find out what happened first. So what did happen?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: He ran. I couldn't shoot him in the back. I tried to catch him. He made it to the road and got hit by a Saracen.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: But you know what the thing is, Fergus?

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: You vanished quite effectively. Became Mister Nobody. And you've no idea how useful that could be.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: We've got some plans here. And we'll need a Mister Nobody to execute them.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Jesus, Fergus, you're a walking cliche. You know we won't leave her out of this. But I'm glad to see you care.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: So I suppose a fuck is out of the question. Keep your head down, Fergus. No sudden moves. And not a whisper to her. You'll be hearing from us.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: But, then, I don't have a choice.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: And then you'll leave her out of it?

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Aye. Then we'll leave her be.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: And what if I say no?

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: We'll be on the other side. We'll move when you do.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Fergus, I think you don't trust me.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Stay late at your work tomorrow night and I'll bring you the gear.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: I take pride in my work.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Get that thing off me, Fergus --

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Give him a cup of tea.

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: Do you want a cup of tea?

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: Made the front page. They'll move now, the fuckers.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Request permission to take the hood off, Tommy.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: The poor whore's suffocating in the heat.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: And anyway, he's seen our faces.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: He described me down to a T. Knows what Jude looks like.

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: You're his keeper. If you don't mind him seeing you, I don't mind. But you're the only one he looks at.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: It's nothing. He's just got a sense of humor, that's all.

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: You're on duty. Keep your fucking mouth shut. Go in and get some sleep.

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: You'll have minimal contact with the prisoner, do you hear me?

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: Because tomorrow we might have to shoot him, that's why.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: I'm a volunteer, am n't I?

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: Good. I was beginning to have my doubts about you for the last few days.

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: Shut up, Jude. You best get some sleep tonight, Fergus.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Request permission to guard the prisoner tonight --

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: Why do you want to do that for?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Would make me feel better about it.

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: Okay. You're a good man, Fergus.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: So it was you all the time.

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: And who's Dave when he's at home?

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: Should blow you away, you know that?

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: I'm getting emotional. And I don't want to get fucking emotional -- you understand, Hennessy?

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: And what's she like between the sheets?

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: And you know what'll happen if you fuck up again, don't you?

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: So what do you think that is, Hennessy?

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: It's a knocking-shop. Tres discreet, huh? He visits his ladies on Tuesday and Thursday nights and Saturday mornings. His security's in the car beyond.

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: Doesn't matter who he is. He is what we would call a legitimate target.

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: Good. So what do you think?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Whoever hits him'll be hit, if those men are any good. And I presume you can't get in.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: What do you mean you can't?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Can't eat through a canvas bag.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: So, what do I look like?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: You're the one about five ten with the killer smile and the baby face.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: How did you know it was her?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Please, man, I'm suffocating in here.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Now, if you took the ropes off, I'd be able to feed myself.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Five ten. Brown eyes. But you're no pinup.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: You trying to hurt my feelings?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Well, I could say the same about you.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: But I won't. We're more polite around these parts.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: You're going to have to do it, aren't you?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: They're going to let that guy die. And you're going to kill me.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: And even if he doesn't die -- you can't just let me loose.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: What do you know about my nature?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I'm talking about your people, not you.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: What the fuck do you know about my people?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Only that you're all tough undeluded motherfuckers. And that it's not in your nature to let me go.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Shut the fuck up, would you?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: And you know the funny thing?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Didn't look like that to me...

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Ah, c'mere. I want to show you something.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Don't you think of it, fucker.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: She's mine. Anyway, she wouldn't suit you.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: So what were you fucking around for, then?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: You fuckers set me up. That bitch --

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Okay. That nice lady. Meets me in a bar. I'm saying what the fuck am I doing here anyway. She buys me a drink. She holds my hand. I'm looking at her saying I don't like you, bitch. But what the fuck. Maybe I'll get to understand.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: What the fuck am I doing here.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: What the fuck were you doing here?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: It was a job. So I get sent to the only place in the world they call you nigger to your face.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: "Go back to your banana tree, nigger." No use telling them I came from Tottenham.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: That game where a bunch of paddies whack sticks at each other?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Well, in Antigua cricket's the black man's game. The kids play it from the age of two. My daddy had me throwing googlies from the age of five. Then we moved to Tottenham and it was something different.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Toffs' game there. But not at home.     .

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: So when you come to shoot me, Paddy, remember, you're getting rid of a shit- hot bowler.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Take it easy, now. Just go slow. Down by that tree.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Well then, you're going to have to take my dick out for me, aren t you?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Now, that was worth waiting for.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Thank you. I had a case of the clap two years ago. Crabs in Ulster. But all in all it's served me well.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I'm sorry. Didn't mean to offend you, Fergus.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Thanks. I know that wasn't easy for you.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: So what's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Means what it says. The scorpion does what is in his nature. Take off the hood, man.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: 'Cause you're kind. It's in your nature.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: See? I was right about you.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Where would you most like to be now, man?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Come on, man. If this shit was all over.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Having a pint in the Rock.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: You lack imagination, Fergus. Think of something more alluring.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Like having a pint in the Metro --

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Having two pints in the Rock.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Having a pint in the Metro, and Dil's having a margarita.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: We got simple tastes, you and me.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: But you fellas never get a break, do you?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Oh, yes. We do a tour of duty and we're finished. But you guys are never finished, are you?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: We don't look on it like that.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I've often wondered how you do it.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Depends on what you believe in.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: That you guys shouldn't be here.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: No. Not bad. Women are trouble, you know that, Fergus?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Dil wasn't trouble. No trouble at all.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Present tense, please. Love her. Whatever she is. I'm thinking of her now, Fergus. Will you think of her too?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Want you to do something, Fergus.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: But they will. As sure as night follows day. They have to. I want you to find her out. Tell her I was thinking of her.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Take the whole lot. I won't need it.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: I told you not to talk that way --

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Go to Millie's Hair Salon in Spitalfields. Take her to the Metro for a margarita. Don't have to tell her who you are. Just tell her Jody was thinking --

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I don't know. Just help me. Give me a cigarette.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I don't want to sleep. Tell me something.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Like the one about the frog?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: And the scorpion. No. Tell me anything.

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: I thought as a child. But when I became a man I put away childish things...

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Not a lot of use, are you, Fergus?

turns.speaker: FERGUS
turns.text: Me? No, I'm not good for much...

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: I'm glad you're doing it, do you know that, Fergus?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Cause you're my friend. And I want you to go to the Metro --

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Hurling's a fast game, isn't it, Fergus?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: So if I ran now, there's no way I'd beat you, is there?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: But if I did... you wouldn't shoot a brother in the back --

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Used to run the mile, you know -- four times round the cricket pitch -- what was that game called?

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: No, fuck the bear. The name. Jude. And it's June. Jude in June.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: You don't know me, do you?

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: You'd know I wouldn't run off.

turns.speaker: JODY
turns.text: Never pissed holding a girl's hand, Jude.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: See, if we took the hood off, we'd have to shoot you. As it is, you've got a fifty-fifty chance.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: It was fun while it lasted.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: I said shut the fuck up --

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: You're crazy. Don't let him, Peter.

turns.speaker: JUDE
turns.text: Leave him alone, Peter. He's in love.

turns.speaker: MAGUIRE
turns.text: That true, Fergus? You in love?
